reviews.text: Took my son and fiance to the Crown to celebrate their engagement. The lounge bar and restaurant are stunningly decorated. The staff have got things just right when dealing with their guests. They are very friendly and efficient. The food was also very special. Although the price was more than I would normally pay it was a special occasion and worth every penny. Three courses for 4 people plus drinks came to £130 approx.
reviews.title: The Perfect Place For Something Special

reviews.text: If the meal is your priority, then the hard seats, plastic tables, modern minimal decor count for nothing. Deliciously prepared and cooked halibut (a decent portion too) with a good veg a wonderful, hot, buttery sizeable fondant potato and p[lenty of lobster sauce/jus; that is my type of food; good ingredients, not dozens of "bits" splashed on the place; not poncy (pretentious); and at sensible cost with smiling convivial waiter. Brillian set-up Mr Chef. Thanks
reviews.title: Proper fish, proper price, proper service
British food at some of its best
reviews.text: An unpretentious menu with locally sourced produce but cooked and prepared to the greatest standards. The wine list is very much worth exploring too. But remember to leave room for desert.
Wonderful service. Thats the good bit.
reviews.title: Very Average
Last minuet stay
reviews.text: The Menu is all over the place with loads of choices but some odd combinations. I had the pigeon to start with and it really was raw, not properly cooked at all. Then had the Barnsley Chop which was beautifully cooked, but served with a bernaise sauce, very odd. The French fries were horrible and very oily along with the mushrooms and onion rings, not a light batter at all.

reviews.title: good choice and high quality
reviews.text: Delicious food, good wine list. A bit pricy but excellent quality

Interesting wide menu with accent on local produce. Lobster bisque very good. Good range of inexpensive food. Big portions. Young attentive staff in a very pleasant ambiance. Lots of local competition has to help keep the standard up. Bar area with a quirky outside area - good place for a casual drink - and it has parking. A bonus in an old market town
reviews.title: Relaxing Gastro Pub

reviews.text: From the menu it looked good, I chose a vegetarian dish that sounded exciting - it was awful, nothing like the description. If a chef/cook does not understand what a marinade is they should not be there. The menu writer needs to train or explain to the cook what a dish is supposed to be. However, my starter (soup) and the dishes my wife ordered were ok - not special. Staff responded well with apologies when I complained and removed item from the bill. So not all bad but you don't expect that sort of problem in a supposedly quality place. Much, much better in 'The Cross' wine bar over the road.
reviews.title: Mixed views, bad and good experience

reviews.text: Went with family members as a second visit - not impressed on first time last year. This visit was a Monday, when not expected to be so busy, as other restaurants are closed early in week. This time overall a better impression with a choice of menu and wines that was interesting and suited to all tastes in party.
reviews.title: Good Food but lacks the 'Wow' Factor

reviews.text: The restaurant area is away from public bar and seating area but is bistro style with limited furnishing and making any noise reverberate - OK for the younger element. The table was well placed but service was straightforward lacking any real hospitality style. The food when ordered came in good time and was well presented and the fish dishes fresh, local and were very good. The risottos were nicely cooked and substantial. The lamb chop was cooked as asked for and tender off the bone but rather overpowered by substantial potato blocks lacking imagination as accompaniment. A good choice of desserts for those who were still hungry!
reviews.title: average
Buzzy atmosphere but no real ambiance.
reviews.text: Saturday night and the restaurant was buzzing with a real mix of people of all ages. There's a good range of food though nothing special given the prices. Service was pleasant but a bit brusque and amateurish - sauces offered after the main course, duplicated requests by staff asking if we wanted drinks when we'd already responded. It's very noisy here - the accoustics are terrible so I'd say fine for a night out with a group of friends so long as you don't want any in depth conversation. I'd far rather go to The British Larder for hugely superior food, service and atmosphere at cheaper prices.

reviews.title: nice pint !
reviews.text: didnt try the food but nice pint of real ale in front of a real fire so that was just perfect on a wintwers night

This place has the clean, smart look. The staff are good and the fact that the place is split into smallish rooms is no great problem for them. The food was not cheap and the quality was underwhelming. As main courses, my wife had a vegetarian tart which was a thin piece of pastry, rocket salad on top and a few chunky walnuts sprinkled over - oh and a sideplate of new potatoes which at this time of year are just not - difficult to eat and not very yummy. I had cod which was well cooked, sat on a bed of potatoes, hot and did not really inspire. The chocolate torte for pudding was a stodgy chocolate slice with some cream. Do not misunderstand me, it was all well cooked and could not be faulted but just a tad boring. This chef comes well recommended and a wealth of experience so our expectations were high, maybe it was just an off day. The coffee was excellent.
reviews.title: Good but not great
Buzzy atmosphere but nothing to write home about. Average.
reviews.text: Busy and buzzy, nice decor - but dreadful lighting in the restaurant - however you're just as likely to get a glass of flat prosecco a good on. Great place to meet friends and hang though.
The menu has ideas above its station and you're not really coming here for the food. It's average - perfectly nice but I've eaten just as well over the road in Prezzo.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: Have popped in here several times over the last few months - have only eaten once, which was delicious, but have used the bar/cafe area (the bit with the boat above the bar) whcih has several plus points.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: 1. Very friendly service - also efficient, which don't always go together
reviews.title: good food friendly atmosphere a good wine list
Lovely evening out with friends
reviews.text: 2. Nice coffee and cake

reviews.title: Crown and Castle eating
reviews.text: 3. Free wi-fi - which works
4. Adnams is very well kept
reviews.title: Contemporary, Smart but Casual
